intro: Oxybaphus toscae, commonly known as the Tuscan oxybaphus, is a rare and striking plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
